description.text: A poster/advertisement of 1979 released Hindi film, "Do Ladke Dono Kadke" showing the main actors, Amol Palekar and Asrani carrying liquor bottles and passing mischievous looks. The upper section of the advertisement shows a close up of the female protagonist, Moushumi Chatterjee. The title translates to "Two Boys and both are poppers"

inscription.text: Romu N. Sippy presents Basu Chatterjee's Do Ladke Dono Kadke starring

Moushumi, Amol Palekar, Asrani, Ranjeet, Iftikhar, Prema Narayan, Dina Pathak, Viju Khote, Mona, Nirmal Kumar, Vinay Sibbal, Niloo Phile, Sawan Varma, Manik Chowdhury, Rajat Kumar, Amal Sen, Pardesi, Harish Chandra, Master Ravi, R.S. description-en: A poster/advertisement of 1979 released Hindi film, "Do Ladke Dono Kadke" showing the main actors, Amol Palekar and Asrani carrying liquor bottles and passing mischievous looks. The upper section of the advertisement shows a close up of the female protagonist, Moushumi Chatterjee. The title translates to "Two Boys and both are poppers" (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie: Two petty thieves decide to rob a house that kidnappers had decided to kidnap a child from, what results is chaos, as the child ends up with the petty thieves, and both the thieves & the kidnappers claiming the ransom; and assorted characters showing up to claim the reward offered by the child's parents. Light hearted comedy, with "Kise khabar kahan dagar jivan ki ley jaye, kab koi sapna bikhare yahan par, kab koi sach ho jaye...." hummable. (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0157545/, last accessed 2011-12-12, story line, leading actors, director. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: As the credits contain several Bengali names, it could be possible that this is a movie which was produced outside of the regularely established Bollywood studios. (gs)
As the credits contain several Bengali names, it could be possible that this is a movie which was produced outside of the regularely established Bollywood studios.

Story line of the movie: Two petty thieves decide to rob a house that kidnappers had decided to kidnap a child from, what results is chaos, as the child ends up with the petty thieves, and both the thieves & the kidnappers claiming the ransom; and assorted characters showing up to claim the reward offered by the child's parents. Light hearted comedy, with "Kise khabar kahan dagar jivan ki ley jaye, kab koi sapna bikhare yahan par, kab koi sach ho jaye...." hummable.
